headline: 3 Colleges Get Their Just Deserts
author: Hans Von Spakovsky
sentences:
A third, Clemson University, narrowly escaped getting hit with a similar type of judgment
Comments:
All colleges that have found in court to have knowingly made false accusations should have their government funding withdrawn.

When the Soviet communists’ hammer-and-sickle flag was lowered at the Kremlin for the last time on Dec. 25, 1991, some said that the last refuge of Marxism was in the academic institutions of the West.
That totalitarian ideology has infected American colleges and universities and other institutions that are purveying cancel culture, wokeism, censorship, and gender dogma that rejects reality.
And two colleges—Oberlin College and Shawnee State University—recently got exactly what they deserve: large legal judgments against them for defamatory and discriminatory misbehavior.
But students, parents, and others are fighting back.
That would wake them up quickly.
